name: svelte-target-blank
description: Adds target="_blank" to external links in Svelte components.
readme: # svelte-target-blank Do you like to set `target="_blank"` on your external links but happen to forget sometimes? Or maybe you have markdown files and it would be nice but cumbersome to set these attributes? `svelte-target-blank` fixes all these external links and lets you know the corresponding files if you want / can edit the code. ## Get started ```sh npm install -D svelte-target-blank ``` Then update your `svelte.config.js` file: ```js import targetBlank from "svelte-target-blank"; /** @type {import('@sveltejs/kit').Config} */ const config = { ..., preprocess: [ vitePreprocess(), mdsvex(mdsvexOptions), targetBlank({ logLevel: 'warn', quietList: '/**/*.md' }) ], ..., }; export default config; ``` If you use a markdown preprocessor like `mdsvex` above, put `svelte-target-blank` after it in the list. This way your external links in markdown files will be normalized too. You're all set! ## Example Now any external link in you markup ```html check this out ``` or in your markdown ```md [check this out](https://external-ressource.com) ``` will be transformed into ```html check this out ``` with a message in the console: ```sh svelte-target-blank found an external link with no 'target' attribute: file: /src/+page.svelte anchor: check this out ``` ## Options `logLevel`: Let's you configure how verbose the preprocessor is - `warn` (default) - Emit a console warning when a missing `target` is found - `quiet` - Silently fix links `quietList`: One or more glob patterns of locations to fix without emitting any warning. Ex: `"/**/*.md"` ## Licence MIT
